Message.Title: Data declaration error
Message.Description:
Cannot determine
type of variable value (circular
constant references?)
Message.Actions:
Check that any referred constants are
correctly defined. If so, the program is
too complex. Try to rewrite the
declarations.

Message.Title: Type error
Message.Description:
Unknown aggregate
type
Message.Actions:
An aggregate may not be used in this
position since there is no expected data
type. Declare data with the desired data
type and aggregate value. Use the name
of the data instead of the aggregate.

Message.Title: Type definition error
Message.Description:
Cannot determine
type of record component
(circular type definitions?)
Message.Actions:
Check that the type of the component is
correctly defined. If so, it could be
a circular definition, the type of a
component could not refer to the its
own record type.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description:
Record name
is ambiguous
Message.Actions:
At least one other object sharing the
same name as the referred record name is
visible from this program position. Make
sure that all object names fulfill the
naming rules regarding uniqueness.

Message.Title: Name error
Message.Description:
Global record
name ambiguous
Message.Actions:
Global type must have names that are
unique among all the global types, data,
global routines and modules in the
entire program. Rename the record
or change the conflicting name.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description:
Alias name
is ambiguous
Message.Actions:
At least one other object sharing the
same name as the referred alias name is
visible from this program position. Make
sure that all object names fulfill the
naming rules regarding uniqueness.

Message.Title: Name error
Message.Description:
Global alias
name ambiguous
Message.Actions:
Global type must have names that are
unique among all the global types, data,
global routines and modules in the
entire program. Rename the alias
or change the conflicting name.

Message.Title: Type definition error
Message.Description:
Type reference
of alias name
is an alias type
Message.Actions:
Check that the type of the component is
correctly defined. If so, it could be
a circular definition. The type of a
component could not refer to its
own record type.

Message.Title: Type definition error
Message.Description:
Cannot determine
type of alias
(circular type definitions?)
Message.Actions:
Check that the type of the alias is
correctly defined. If so, it could be
a circular definition, the type of an
alias could not refer to a record that
use this alias as a component.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description:
Record component name
is ambiguous
Message.Actions:
At least one other object sharing the
same name as the referred component is
visible from this program position. Make
sure that all object names fulfill the
aming rules regarding uniqueness.

Message.Title: Type definition error
Message.Description:
Place holder for
record component not allowed in
definition of named record
Message.Actions:
Complete the definition or change
the data name to a place holder.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description:
Cannot use the semi-value type
for record components

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description:
Illegal reference
to installed task object
from shared object
Message.Actions:
Install the referred object shared, or
install the referring ReaL object/
archive or RAPID module in each task
(not shared).

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description: Cannot use semi-value type for arrays

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description: not procedure reference
Message.Actions:
The specified name identifies an object other than a procedure.
Check if the desired procedure is hidden by some other object with the same name.

Message.Title: Argument error
Message.Description: Argument for 'PERS' parameter is not a persistent reference or is read only
Message.Actions:
Make sure the argument is just a persistent or persistent parameter reference and that it is writable.
Do not use () around the argument.

Message.Title: Argument error
Message.Description: Argument for 'VAR' parameter is not variable reference or is read only
Message.Actions:
Make sure the argument is just a variable or variable parameter reference and that it is writable.
Do not use () around the argument.

Message.Title: Instruction error
Message.Description: The Interrupt number is not static variable reference, or it is shared, or it is read only
Message.Actions:
Make sure the interrupt number is just a variable or variable parameter reference. The variable must be static and not shared. The variable may
not be read only.

Message.Title: Value error
Message.Description: Integer value is too large
Message.Actions: The value of the expression must be an integer value. The current value is outside the integer range.

Message.Title: Value error
Message.Description: is not an integer value
Message.Actions: The value of the expression must be an exact integer value. The current value has a fraction part.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description: Reference to unknown entire data
Message.Actions:
No data (or other object) with the specified name is visible from this
program position.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description: Reference to unknown function
Message.Actions: No function (or other object) with the specified name is visible from this program position.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description: Reference to unknown procedure
Message.Actions: No procedure (or other object) with the specified name is visible from this program position.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description: Reference to unknown trap
Message.Actions: No trap (or other object) with the specified name is visible from this program position.

Message.Title: Syntax error.
Message.Description: Expected

Message.Title: Syntax error
Message.Description: Unexpected

Message.Title: Syntax error
Message.Description: Expected but found

Message.Title: Syntax error
Message.Description: Syntax error, stack backed up

Message.Title: Syntax error
Message.Description: Syntax error, parsing terminated

Message.Title: Numerical value for symbol is out of range.
Message.Description: Numerical value for symbol is out of range.
Message.Actions: Make the value smaller

Message.Title: String too long
Message.Description: The string is too long.
Message.Actions: Make the string shorter.

Message.Title: TxId is out of range
Message.Description: The Text identifier is out of range.

Message.Title: Aggregate is out of range
Message.Description: The aggregate is out of range.
Message.Actions: Make the aggregate smaller

Message.Title: Integer out of range
Message.Description: The integer is out of range.
Message.Actions: Make the integer smaller.

Message.Title: Parser stack is full
Message.Description: The parser stack is full.
Message.Actions: Reduce program complexity

Message.Title: Not enough heap space.
Message.Description: There is not enough heap space to fulfill the action.
Message.Actions: Rewrite your program

Message.Title: Identifier is reserved word in current language
Message.Description: The identifier is a reserved word in current language.
Message.Actions: Change the name of the identifier

Message.Title: Identifier too long
Message.Description: The name of the identifier is too long.
Message.Actions: Rename the identifier with a shorter name.

Message.Title: Placeholder too long
Message.Description: The placeholder is too long.
Message.Actions: Rename the placeholder with a shorter name.

Message.Title: Unexpected unknown token
Message.Description: Unexpected unknown token.
Message.Actions: Remove the unknown token.

Message.Title: Initial value of PERS not updated.
Message.Description:
The initial value of PERS: will not be updated.
A PERS with the same name in another task has already an initial value of the PERS.
Message.Actions:
Check the value in the Program Data window to see that the PERS have the correct value.
if necessary, unload modules with that PERS from all tasks and reload with new initial value.
The PERS is of type: .

Message.Title: Data declaration error
Message.Description: TASK illegal in routine variable declaration
Message.Actions: Only program data declarations may have the TASK attribute. Remove the TASK attribute or move the declaration outside of the routine.

Message.Title: Argument error
Message.Description:
Task : Argument for
'PERS' parameter is not
persistent reference or is read only
Message.Actions: Make sure the argument is just a persistent or persistent parameter reference and that it is writable. Do not use () around the argument.

Message.Title: Argument error
Message.Description: Task : Argument for 'VAR' parameter is not variable reference or is read only
Message.Actions:
Make sure the argument
is just a variable or variable
parameter reference and that
it is writable.
Do not use () around the argument.

Message.Title: Instruction error
Message.Description:
Task : Interrupt number is not a static variable reference,
is shared, or is read only.
Message.Actions:
Make sure the interrupt number is just
a variable or variable parameter
reference. The variable must be
static and not shared. The variable may
not be read only.

Message.Title: Value error
Message.Description:
Task : Integer value
too large
Message.Actions:
The value of the expression must be an
integer value. The current value is
outside the integer range.

Message.Title: Value error
Message.Description:
Task : not
integer value
Message.Actions:
The value of the expression must be an
exact integer value. The current value
has a fraction part.

Message.Title: Errors in RAPID program.
Message.Description: Task : There are errors in the RAPID program.
Message.Actions:
Check for RAPID errors using Check program
in the Program editor and correct
the program.

Message.Title: Option is missing.
Message.Description: The instruction requires the option .
Message.Consequences: The program will not execute properly.
Message.Causes: The system image doesn't include the required option.
Message.Actions: Update the system image with the required option.

Message.Title: Errors in RAPID program.
Message.Description: Task : There are errors in the RAPID program.
Message.Actions:
Take the following actions to be able to debug the program:
1 Change the type of the task to NORMAL.
2 Restart the controller.
3 Check for RAPID errors and correct the program.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description:
Task : Reference to
unknown entire data
Message.Actions:
No data (or other object) with the
specified name is visible from this
program position.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description: Task : Reference to unknown function
Message.Actions:
No function (or other object) with the
specified name is visible from this
program position.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description: Task : Reference to unknown procedure
Message.Actions:
No procedure (or other object) with the specified name is visible from this program position.
To avoid run time errors like this, add code in error handler to handle this.
ERRNO will be set to "ERR_REFUNKPRC".

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description: Task : Reference to unknown trap
Message.Actions:
No trap (or other object) with the
specified name is visible from this
program position.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description:
Task :
Reference to unknown data (or other object) found during execution of module .
Message.Actions: Check the program for unresolved references.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description:
Task :
Reference to unknown module .
Message.Actions: No module (or other object) with the specified name is visible from this program position. Check the program for incorrect module reference or if the module is missing.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description:
Task :
Reference to object that is not a module.
Message.Actions:
The specified name identifies an object other than a module.
Check the program for incorrect module reference.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description:
Task :
Reference to module is ambiguous.
Message.Actions: At least one other object sharing the same name as the referred module is visible from this program position. Make sure that all object names fulfill the naming rules regarding uniqueness.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description:
Task :
Reference to procedure is ambiguous.
Message.Actions: At least one other object sharing the same name as the referred procedure is visible from this program position. Make sure that all object names fulfill the naming rules regarding uniqueness.

Message.Title: Instruction error
Message.Description:
Task : Variable and trap
routine already connected
Message.Actions:
It is not legal to connect a specific
variable with a trap routine
more than once.

Message.Title: Argument error
Message.Description:
Task :
is second present conditional argument
for excluding parameters
Message.Actions:
Arguments may not be present for more
than one parameter from a list of
parameters that exclude each other.

Message.Title: Execution error
Message.Description:
Task : Late binding
procedure call error
Message.Actions:
There is an error in the procedure call
instruction. See previous message for
the actual cause.

Message.Title: Value error
Message.Description: Task : Division by zero
Message.Actions:
Cannot divide by 0. Rewrite the program
so that the divide operation is not
executed when the divisor is 0.

Message.Title: Limit error
Message.Description:
Task :
The configured maximum
number of RETRYs ( retries)
is exceeded.
Message.Actions:
The error correction performed before
the RETRY instruction is executed, is
probably not enough to cure the error.
Check the error handler.

Message.Title: Instruction error
Message.Description:
Task : Attempt to
execute place holder
Message.Actions:
Remove the place holder or the
instruction containing it, or make the
instruction complete. Then continue
execution.

Message.Title: Execution error
Message.Description:
Task : Function does not
return any value
Message.Actions:
The end of the function has been reached
without a RETURN instruction being
executed. Add a RETURN instruction
specifying a function return value.

Message.Title: Value error
Message.Description:
Task : Illegal
orientation value
Message.Actions:
Attempt to use illegal orientation
(quaternion) value

Message.Title: Value error
Message.Description: Task : Illegal error number in .
Message.Actions: Use error numbers in the range 1-90 or book error numbers with the instruction BookErrNo.

Message.Title: Limit error
Message.Description:
Task : No more interrupt
number available
Message.Actions:
There is a limited number of interrupt
numbers available. Rewrite the program
to use fewer interrupt numbers. This
message may also occur as a consequence
of a system error.

Message.Title: Type error
Message.Description:
Task : Dimensions
and of conformant array
dimension number are incompatible
Message.Actions:
The array is not of the expected size.
Array assignment may only be performed
on arrays of identical size.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description:
Task : Optional
parameter not present
Message.Actions:
The value of a non-present optional
parameter may not be referred. Use the
predefined function 'Present' to check
the presence of the parameter before
using its value.

Message.Title: Value error
Message.Description:
Task : Array index
for dimension number out of bounds
(1-)
Message.Actions:
The array index value is non-positive or
violates the declared size of the array.

Message.Title: Value error
Message.Description: Task : RAPID String too long
Message.Actions: String value exceeds the maximum allowed length. Rewrite the program to use strings of less length.

Message.Title: Interrupt queue full
Message.Description: Execution of all normal tasks has stopped. Too many interrupts has occurred in while executing a trap routine.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to blocked state and can not be restarted before moving the program pointer to an arbitrary position.
Message.Causes: Too many interrupts has occurred while executing a trap routine. This can be caused by heavy CPU load.
Message.Actions:
1) Minimize execution time in the trap routine.
2) Disable/enable interrupts while executing a trap routine using the Isleep or Iwatch commands.

Message.Title: Value error
Message.Description: Task : Illegal error number in
Message.Actions: Error numbers used in an ERROR handler must be positive.

Message.Title: Error event queue full
Message.Description: Task : The program was already executing an error event when a new event occurred.
Message.Actions: Attend the cause of the error event and restart the program.

Message.Title: Error context already consumed
Message.Description: An error event in task has occurred. The context of the RAPID instruction that has generated this event is however already consumed. No error handling is therefore possible to execute.
Message.Actions: Attend the cause of the error event and restart the program.

Message.Title: Interrupt removed from queue
Message.Description: All interrupts have been deleted from the interrupt queue in task .
Message.Consequences: No trap routines, connected with the interrupt, may be executed.
Message.Causes:
-The program has been stopped
-A service routine or an event routine may be executing.
-The program is executing in step mode.

Message.Title: Execution error
Message.Description: Task : Execution aborted
Message.Actions:
Execution was aborted due to a fatal
error.

Message.Title: Limit error
Message.Description:
Task : Execution stack
overflow
Message.Actions:
The program is too complex to execute.
Probably the program contains recursive
routines.

Message.Title: Execution error
Message.Description: The execution of task has been stopped by a runtime error.
Message.Consequences: The program execution is immediately halted.
Message.Causes: The program error is considered UNRECOVERABLE so no error recovery attempt by an error handler routine (if used) was allowed. The actual cause of the error may vary, and is likely to be specified in an event log message logged simultaneously as this one.
Message.Actions: 1) Check other event log messages logged simultaneously to determine the actual cause.

Message.Title: Execution error
Message.Description:
Task : Illegal return
code from ReaL routine
This is always caused by an internal
error in the ReaL routine.

Message.Title: Execution error
Message.Description:
Task : Execution could
not be restarted
Execution of the program could not be
continued after power failure.
Message.Actions: Restart the program.

Message.Title: Name error
Message.Description:
Task : Procedure name
is not a RAPID identifier excluding
reserved words
Message.Actions:
The procedure name, must be a legal
RAPID identifier not equal to any of
the reserved words of the RAPID
language. Change the name expression.

Message.Title: Limit error
Message.Description:
Task : Runtime stack
overflow
The program is too complex to execute.
Probably the program contains recursive
routines.

Message.Title: Execution error
Message.Description: The execution of task has been stopped by a runtime error .
Message.Consequences: The program execution is immediately halted.
Message.Causes: The program error is considered RECOVERABLE but the error was not recovered. The actual cause of the error may vary, and is likely to be specified in an event log message logged simultaneously as this one.
Message.Actions: 1) Check other event log messages logged simultaneously to determine the actual cause.

Message.Title: Execution error
Message.Description: Task : Unhandled error
Message.Actions:
An error occurred in called instruction but was not handled by any ERROR clause in the program.
Check the previous error or warning in the common log for the cause.

Message.Title: Execution error
Message.Description:
Task : Unhandled
non-fatal runtime error
Message.Actions:
A non-fatal runtime error has occurred
but was not handled by any ERROR
clause.

Message.Title: Value error
Message.Description:
Task : Array dimension
number out of range (1-)
Message.Actions:
The value of the 'DimNo' parameter of
the 'Dim' function must be an integer
value in the specified range.

Message.Title: Type error
Message.Description: Task : Data is not an array
Message.Actions: The 'DatObj' parameter of the 'Dim' function must be an array.

Message.Title: Value error
Message.Description:
Task : Unknown interrupt
number
Message.Actions:
Check that the specified interrupt
variable has been initialized by
CONNECT, and that the interrupt has been
defined using the ISignalDI or other
interrupt definition instruction.

Message.Title: Value error
Message.Description:
Task :
Object is of non-value type
Message.Actions: Use expression or data object of value or semivalue type.

Message.Title: Parameter error
Message.Description:
Parameters in
and is not
matching (late binding)
Message.Actions:
Make sure that all procedures that are
called from the same late binding node
have matching parameters. I.e. they
should be matching concerning base type,
mode and required/optional parameters.

Message.Title: Cannot Deactivate Safe Interrupt
Message.Description:
Task:
It is not possible to deactivate a Safe Interrupt with the instruction ISleep.
Program ref.
Message.Actions: Recovery:

Message.Title: Name error
Message.Description:
Task : Ambiguous symbol
name
Message.Actions:
Installed objects must have names that
are unique. Rename the object or change
the conflicting name.

Message.Title: Limit error
Message.Description:
Task : Error when
creating sdb entry for
Message.Actions:
An error occurred when the persistent
was to be inserted into the shared
database. Probably the database is full.

Message.Title: Type definition error
Message.Description:
Task : Alias
of alias
not allowed
Message.Actions:
It is not possible to define an alias
type equal to another alias type.
Instead, define two alias types equal to
the same atomic or record type.

Message.Title: Symbol definition error
Message.Description:
Task : 'ANYTYPE#'
parameter cannot be
dimensioned
Message.Actions:
Remove the dimension specification.
'ANYTYPE#' includes array types.

Message.Title: Symbol definition error
Message.Actions: Use another type.

Message.Title: Parameter error
Message.Description:
Task : 'alt' must not be
set for first optional parameter
in alternatives list
Message.Actions:
Make sure that only the second and
following in each list of excluding
optional parameters are marked as
alternatives.

Message.Title: Parameter error
Message.Description:
Task : REF mode
parameter cannot be
dimensioned
Message.Actions:
Remove the array dimension
specification, or change the mode of the
parameter.
